definition: to be hard on sb/to deliberately make things difficult
surname Diao
artful/wicked
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to put up innumerable obstacles/to create all kinds of difficulties (idiom)

sentences.english: The reporter wants to heckle the candidate with those embarrassing question.
sentences.chinese: 记者想用那些让人难为情的问题来刁难这位候选人。

sentences.english: The German Emperor took revenge on China by making thinas difficult in the ceremony and propriety.
sentences.chinese: 出于报复心理，德皇在礼仪问题上刁难载沣使团。

sentences.english: Other behaviors of making things difficult for foreign-investment enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 其他刁难外商投资企业的行为。

sentences.english: The bad children left the room dirty to spite their maid .
sentences.chinese: 那些坏孩子把房间弄脏来刁难女佣人。

sentences.english: At school, Dicky is subjected to harassment by his classmates and teachers.
sentences.chinese: Dicky在学校里又遭到同学的欺负和老师的刁难。

sentences.english: Now that would throw up a curve ball that would keep a smile on the faces of the Yamaha guys wouldn't it?
sentences.chinese: 现在好好刁难一下会让雅马哈的人面露笑意吧？

sentences.english: The bad children left the room dirty to spite the maid.
sentences.chinese: 那些坏孩子把房间弄脏，以此来刁难女佣人。

sentences.english: The reporter wanted to heckle the candidate with those embarrassing questions.
sentences.chinese: 记者想用那些让人难为情的问题来刁难这位候选人。

sentences.english: These political difficulties are piled on top of cultural difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 这些政治刁难是由文化困境积重难返造成的。

sentences.english: His wife and the manager fang not understand.
sentences.chinese: 方经理的刁难与妻子的不懂得。

sentences.english: Everybody else accepts the decision. Why must you be so bloody-minded?
sentences.chinese: 别人都同意这个决议，你为甚么偏要故意刁难？

sentences.english: Soldiers in this country often use their power to embarrass and deprecate the scholars.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们经常用武力来刁难或迫害学者。

sentences.english: You take good care of a butterfly, secretly everywhere deep down the court.
sentences.chinese: 天涯精心照顾着梦蝶一家，暗中处处刁难落魄的庭深。

sentences.english: Ever since their argument the principal has been making it hot for the new teacher.
sentences.chinese: 自从发生争吵之后，校长老师刁难这位新老师。

definition: to put up innumerable obstacles/to create all kinds of difficulties (idiom)
to censure
to pick fault with/to spot the differences/to nitpick/to pick a quarrel/to find complaint with
sarcastic comments (idiom)/to make sarcastic comments
to taunt/to ridicule/to jeer at/to treat coldly/to abandon
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to crowd out/to push aside/to supplant
to baffle/to humiliate/shame/dishonor/humiliation
over and over again (idiom)
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to pester endlessly (idiom)/an annoying troublemaker
to contradict (elders or superiors)
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
variant of 找茬[zhao3 cha2]
